WebhookURL.description:
A String value which supports templating environment variables enclosed in {{ and }}.
Template example: https://{{ACTION_API_DOMAIN}}/create-user

TableEntry.description: Representation of a table in metadata, "tables.yaml" and "metadata.json"
TableEntry.title: TableEntry

CustomColumnNames.description: A JSON Object of Postgres column name to GraphQL name mapping
CustomColumnNames.title: CustomColumnNames

Function.description:
A custom SQL function to add to the GraphQL schema with configuration.
https://hasura.io/docs/1.0/graphql/manual/api-reference/schema-metadata-api/custom-functions.html#args-syntax
Function.title: Function

session_argument.description:
Function argument which accepts session info JSON
Currently, only functions which satisfy the following constraints can be exposed over the GraphQL API (terminology from Postgres docs):
- Function behaviour: ONLY `STABLE` or `IMMUTABLE`
- Return type: MUST be `SETOF <table-name>`
- Argument modes: ONLY `IN`
session_argument.title: session_argument

using.description: Use one of the available ways to define an object relationship
using.title: using

ObjRelUsing.description:
Use one of the available ways to define an object relationship
https://hasura.io/docs/1.0/graphql/manual/api-reference/schema-metadata-api/relationship.html#objrelusing
ObjRelUsing.title: ObjRelUsing

foreign_key_constraint_on.description: The column with foreign key constraint
foreign_key_constraint_on.title: foreign_key_constraint_on

manual_configuration.description: Manual mapping of table and columns
manual_configuration.title: manual_configuration

ObjRelUsingManualMapping.description:
Manual mapping of table and columns
https://hasura.io/docs/1.0/graphql/manual/api-reference/schema-metadata-api/relationship.html#objrelusingmanualmapping
ObjRelUsingManualMapping.title: ObjRelUsingManualMapping

remote_table.description: The table to which the relationship has to be established
remote_table.title: remote_table

column_mapping.description: Mapping of columns from current table to remote table
column_mapping.title: column_mapping

using.description: Use one of the available ways to define an array relationship
using.title: using

ArrRelUsing.description:
Use one of the available ways to define an object relationship
https://hasura.io/docs/1.0/graphql/manual/api-reference/schema-metadata-api/relationship.html#arrrelusing
ArrRelUsing.title: ArrRelUsing

foreign_key_constraint_on.description: The column with foreign key constraint
foreign_key_constraint_on.title: foreign_key_constraint_on

manual_configuration.description: Manual mapping of table and columns
manual_configuration.title: manual_configuration

ArrRelUsingFKeyOn.description:
The column with foreign key constraint
https://hasura.io/docs/1.0/graphql/manual/api-reference/schema-metadata-api/relationship.html#arrrelusingfkeyon
ArrRelUsingFKeyOn.title: ArrRelUsingFKeyOn

ArrRelUsingManualMapping.description:
Manual mapping of table and columns
https://hasura.io/docs/1.0/graphql/manual/api-reference/schema-metadata-api/relationship.html#arrrelusingmanualmapping
ArrRelUsingManualMapping.title: ArrRelUsingManualMapping

remote_table.description: The table to which the relationship has to be established
remote_table.title: remote_table

column_mapping.description: Mapping of columns from current table to remote table
column_mapping.title: column_mapping

ColumnPresetsExpression.description:
Preset values for columns that can be sourced from session variables or static values.
https://hasura.io/docs/1.0/graphql/manual/api-reference/schema-metadata-api/syntax-defs.html#columnpresetexp
ColumnPresetsExpression.title: ColumnPresetsExpression

check.description: This expression has to hold true for every new row that is inserted
check.title: check

set.description: Preset values for columns that can be sourced from session variables or static values
set.title: set

columns.description: Can insert into only these columns (or all when '*' is specified)
columns.title: columns

backend_only.description:
When set to true the mutation is accessible only if x-hasura-use-backend-only-permissions session variable exists
and is set to true and request is made with x-hasura-admin-secret set if any auth is configured
backend_only.title: backend_only

columns.description: Only these columns are selectable (or all when '*' is specified)
columns.title: columns

computed_fields.description: Only these computed fields are selectable
computed_fields.title: computed_fields

limit.description: The maximum number of rows that can be returned
limit.title: limit

filter.description: Only the rows where this precondition holds true are selectable
filter.title: filter

check.description: Postcondition which must be satisfied by rows which have been updated
check.title: check

set.description: Preset values for columns that can be sourced from session variables or static values
set.title: set

columns.description: Only these columns are selectable (or all when '*' is specified)
columns.title: columns

filter.description: Only the rows where this precondition holds true are updatable
filter.title: filter

filter.description: Only the rows where this precondition holds true are updatable
filter.title: filter

name.description: Name of the new computed field
name.title: name

table_argument.description: Name of the argument which accepts a table row type. If omitted, the first argument is considered a table argument
table_argument.title: table_argument

session_argument.description: Name of the argument which accepts the Hasura session object as a JSON/JSONB value. If omitted, the Hasura session object is not passed to the function
session_argument.title: session_argument

EventTrigger.description:
NOTE: The metadata type doesn't QUITE match the "create" arguments here
https://hasura.io/docs/1.0/graphql/manual/api-reference/schema-metadata-api/event-triggers.html#create-event-trigger
EventTrigger.title: EventTrigger

value_from_env.description: Name of the environment variable which holds the value of the header
value_from_env.title: value_from_env

num_retries.description:
Number of times to retry delivery.
Default: 0
num_retries.title: num_retries

interval_sec.description:
Number of seconds to wait between each retry.
Default: 10
interval_sec.title: interval_sec

timeout_sec.description:
Number of seconds to wait for response before timing out.
Default: 60
timeout_sec.title: timeout_sec

schedule.description: Cron expression at which the trigger should be invoked.
schedule.title: schedule

payload.description: Any JSON payload which will be sent when the webhook is invoked.
payload.title: payload

headers.description: List of headers to be sent with the webhook
headers.title: headers

retry_conf.description: Retry configuration if scheduled invocation delivery fails
retry_conf.title: retry_conf

include_in_metadata.description: Flag to indicate whether a trigger should be included in the metadata. When a cron trigger is included in the metadata, the user will be able to export it when the metadata of the graphql-engine is exported.
include_in_metadata.title: include_in_metadata

num_retries.description:
Number of times to retry delivery.
Default: 0
num_retries.title: num_retries

retry_interval_seconds.description:
Number of seconds to wait between each retry.
Default: 10
retry_interval_seconds.title: retry_interval_seconds

timeout_seconds.description:
Number of seconds to wait for response before timing out.
Default: 60
timeout_seconds.title: timeout_seconds

tolerance_seconds.description:
Number of seconds between scheduled time and actual delivery time that is acceptable. If the time difference is more than this, then the event is dropped.
Default: 21600 (6 hours)
tolerance_seconds.title: tolerance_seconds

RemoteRelationship.description:
NOTE: Metadata shape is slightly different than "create" arguments here
https://hasura.io/docs/1.0/graphql/manual/api-reference/schema-metadata-api/remote-relationships.html#args-syntax
RemoteRelationship.title: RemoteRelationship

hasura_fields.description:
Column(s) in the table that is used for joining with remote schema field.
All join keys in remote_field must appear here.
hasura_fields.title: hasura_fields

remote_schema.description: Name of the remote schema to join with
remote_schema.title: remote_schema

remote_field.description: The schema tree ending at the field in remote schema which needs to be joined with.
remote_field.title: remote_field

RemoteField.description:
A recursive tree structure that points to the field in the remote schema that needs to be joined with.
It is recursive because the remote field maybe nested deeply in the remote schema.
https://hasura.io/docs/1.0/graphql/manual/api-reference/schema-metadata-api/remote-relationships.html#remotefield
RemoteField.title: RemoteField

field.description:
A recursive tree structure that points to the field in the remote schema that needs to be joined with.
It is recursive because the remote field maybe nested deeply in the remote schema.
https://hasura.io/docs/1.0/graphql/manual/api-reference/schema-metadata-api/remote-relationships.html#remotefield
field.title: field

InputArguments.description:
Note: Table columns can be referred by prefixing $ e.g $id.
https://hasura.io/docs/1.0/graphql/manual/api-reference/schema-metadata-api/remote-relationships.html#inputarguments
InputArguments.title: InputArguments

collection.description: Name of a query collection to be added to the allow-list
collection.title: collection

name.title: name

name.title: name

description.title: description

fields.title: fields

relationships.title: relationships

name.description: Name of the Input object type
name.title: name

description.description: Description of the Input object type
description.title: description

type.description: GraphQL type of the Input object type
type.title: type

name.description: Name of the relationship, shouldnâ€™t conflict with existing field names
name.title: name

remote_table.description: The table to which relationship is defined
remote_table.title: remote_table

field_mapping.description: Mapping of fields of object type to columns of remote table
field_mapping.title: field_mapping

is_deprecated.description: If set to true, the enum value is marked as deprecated
is_deprecated.title: is_deprecated

Action.description:
NOTE: Metadata type is slightly different than "create" type
https://hasura.io/docs/1.0/graphql/manual/api-reference/schema-metadata-api/actions.html#args-syntax
Action.title: Action

handler.description:
A String value which supports templating environment variables enclosed in {{ and }}.
Template example: https://{{ACTION_API_DOMAIN}}/create-user
handler.title: handler
